verses.text: 在哥林多此後，保羅離開雅典，來到哥林多，
遇見一個生在本都的猶太人，名叫亞居拉。因為革老丟下令所有的猶太人都要離開羅馬，所以亞居拉最近同他的妻子百基拉從意大利來了，保羅就去找他們。

words.note: Lit. 'Judea person'
Indicates a consequence or immediate succession

verses.text: 他們是以做帳棚為業的，因為是同業，保羅就與他們同住，一同工作。

words.note: Often means 'using' or 'by means of'
Indicates a consequence or immediate succession

verses.text: 每逢安息日，保羅在會堂辯論，勸導猶太人和希臘人歸主。

words.note: Lit. 'rest day'
Refers to a Jewish synagogue in biblical context.
Lit. 'Greece person'

words.definition: to turn to the Lord, convert

verses.text: 西拉和提摩太從馬其頓下來的時候，保羅就專心傳揚主的道，向猶太人極力證明耶穌是基督。

words.note: Used to connect a descriptive clause to a noun, similar to 'when' or 'at the time of'.
Indicates a consequence or immediate succession
Often used for spreading news or doctrine
In biblical context, refers to God's word or teaching.
Transliteration of Greek 'Christos', meaning 'Anointed One'.

verses.text: 但是他們抗拒、褻瀆，保羅就抖著衣服，對他們說：「你們的罪你們自己承擔，這與我無關。從今以後，我要到外族人那裡去了。」

words.note: Often implies active resistance or defiance.
Refers to disrespectful treatment of sacred things.
A common fixed expression.
Literally 'outside ethnic people'; refers to non-Jews.

verses.text: 他離開那裡，到了提多．猶士都的家去。這人是敬拜 神的，他的家靠近會堂。

words.note: A Roman convert whose home Paul moved to.
The raised dot indicates reverence for the divine being.

verses.text: 會堂主管基利司布和他全家都信了主，許多哥林多人也聽了道，信了主，而且受了洗。

words.note: Synagogue ruler who converted to Christianity.
A title for Jesus or God.
People from Corinth, a city in Greece.
Refers to the message or teaching of God/Christ.
A verb-object compound meaning 'receive baptism'.

verses.text: 夜裡，主藉著異象對保羅說：「不要怕，只管講，不要閉口！

words.note: Refers to a divine revelation or supernatural sight.
Implies to just proceed without worry or hesitation.

verses.text: 有我與你同在，必定沒有人能害你，因為在這城裡有許多屬我的人。」

words.note: More formal than '跟' or '和'.

verses.text: 保羅在那裡住了一年零六個月，把 神的道教導他們。

words.note: Used to connect numbers, similar to 'and' in English
The 'bǎ' construction emphasizes the disposal or handling of an object.
Here referring to the 'Word of God' or 'doctrine'.

verses.text: 當迦流作亞該亞省長的時候，猶太人一致起來攻擊保羅，拉他到審判臺前，

words.note: Used as a verb complement to indicate the beginning of an action.

verses.text: 說：「這個人勸人不照著律法去敬拜 神。」

words.note: Indicates direction or purpose of action.

verses.text: 保羅剛要開口，迦流就對猶太人說：「猶太人啊，如果有犯法或邪惡的罪行，我當然要耐心聽你們；

words.note: Expresses a sigh, admiration, or warning.

verses.text: 但所爭論的若是關於字句、名稱和你們的律法，你們就應當自己處理。我不願意審判這件事！」

words.note: Used before a verb to form a nominalized phrase, often passive.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'that which is disputed'.
Literary or formal equivalent of 如果 (rúguǒ).

verses.text: 於是就把他們從審判臺前趕出去。

words.note: Lit. 'examine-judge platform'

verses.text: 眾人揪住會堂主管蘇提尼，在審判臺前打他。這些事迦流一概不理。

words.note: Lit. 'examine-judge platform'

verses.text: 結束第二次宣教旅程保羅住了許多日子，然後辭別弟兄們，坐船去敘利亞，同行的有百基拉和亞居拉。他因為許過願，現在期滿了，就在堅革里剃了頭髮。

words.note: Often means 'to evangelize' (verb); here it functions adjectivally.
Commonly used in Christian contexts for fellow believers.
Often used in 許願 (xǔyuàn) 'make a wish/vow'.
Often used in 許願 (xǔyuàn) 'make a wish/vow'.

verses.text: 到了以弗所，保羅留他們在那裡，自己卻到會堂去，跟猶太人辯論。
眾人請他多住些時候，他沒有答應，
卻辭別他們說：「 神若許可，我還要回到你們這裡來。」於是從以弗所開船去了。

words.note: Often preceded by a space in some Bible versions.

verses.text: 保羅在該撒利亞登岸，上耶路撒冷問候教會，然後下安提阿去。

words.note: Lit. 'teaching assembly'

verses.text: 第三次宣教旅程住了一些時候，他又動身，先後經過加拉太地區和弗呂家，堅固眾門徒。

words.note: Lit. 'proclaim teaching'
Often functions as a prefix for plural nouns.
Lit. 'school followers'

verses.text: 亞波羅在以弗所傳道有一個生在亞歷山太的猶太人，名叫亞波羅，來到了以弗所。他很有口才，擅長講解聖經。

words.note: Lit. 'spread the Way'
Refers to a person of Jewish ethnicity/religion.
Lit. 'holy writings'

verses.text: 這人在主的道上受過訓練，心靈火熱，很準確地講論，並且教導人關於耶穌的事，但他只曉得約翰的洗禮。

words.note: Often refers to 'the Way' of God/Christ.
Used as a postposition to indicate 'in the sphere of'.
Lit. 'fire hot'
Lit. 'washing rite'

verses.text: 這人在會堂裡放膽講論起來；百基拉和亞居拉聽了，就把他接來，把 神的道更準確地向他講解。

words.note: Specifically refers to Jewish synagogues in Bible context.
Suffix indicating location 'inside'.
Lit. 'release one's courage'.
Used as a verb complement to indicate the commencement of an action.
A directional verb compound, implying taking someone to one's own place.
Refers to the Christian God; honorific blank space often precedes in Chinese Bibles.
Here, 'the word of God' or 'the truth of God'.
Follows an adjective to form an adverbial phrase.

verses.text: 亞波羅有意要到亞該亞去，弟兄們就鼓勵他，又寫信請門徒接待他。他到了那裡，對那些蒙恩信主的人幫助很多，

words.note: Refers to fellow believers, not just biological brothers.
Connects an attributive to the noun it modifies.

verses.text: 因為他當眾有力地駁倒猶太人，引用聖經證明耶穌是基督。

words.note: Follows an adjective to form an adverbial phrase.
A verb-complement construction, meaning to refute successfully, causing the other side to 'fall'.
Refers to the people of Judea or those adhering to Judaism.
